I did a lot of research before purchasing this tv. It provides stock android interface, Bluetooth 5.0, and easy to access remote keys like hotstar, youtube etc. The software gets regular updates and is easy to use. It is far more better than purchasing some chinese brand TV.

Super android TV in such a excellent

Superb smart android TV such a excellent price, it's really value for money.
Superb picture and sound quality. Good smart features
Smooth connectivity and screen cast is also good through crime cast features

Reviewing after three months of extensive usage.
It's a tv which pays you for every penny. Realme is a good choice now, but I had no other choice when I was buying. But, still I think you should go with this tv just because of the reliability and trust it has made in recent past.
And when it comes to buying a tv, always look out for an Android tv. You will everytime be amazed knowing how capable your television gets with an OS. And moreover, it has all the ubiquitous apps pre-installed.
Without being too subjective let us go through the pros and cons::

PROS::
+ Great picture quality at this price. The dark scenes are darker. Vibrant and soothing to eyes.

+ Sound quality is awesome. (I had to turndown my plan of attaching a 2.1 sound system)

+ Netflix actually works at 1080p :)

+ Remote is detailed and user-friendly.

+ Wi-Fi connectivity is flawless.

+ Doesn't heat up even after 8hrs of continuous usage.


CONS::

- Chromecast is troublesome. The working is very intermittent and flaky. I am unable to cast my laptop yet. Mobile casting is less of a worry (if unlucky try to unplug the power cable and re-plug).

- Some times the response time is noticeable. But yes, SOME times. This is understood at this price and the RAM it got.

- Missing a microphone on remote control. Actually, I am very much used to Sony BRAVIA. But that costed me more than 1lac. But, it is obviously a trivial change to deploy and would raise the brand value.

My verdict::

Being an electronics professional, I can tell you this tv can keep you entertained for atleast 3 years. After that, if not hardware the software and OS would get obsolete for the RAM size it's equipped with. But, at this price I suggest it as a definite buy. Go for it, you won't be dissappointed. :) :)

Although probably not many people will come accross this review, but still going to explain anyway.

The panel is brilliant. I haven't tested other tvs in this range but I've seen high priced tv panel and this definitely holds up it's ground. Considering it's only hd ready not full hd, it's really good. Though the default settings of the tv might make you think otherwise. Remember to reduce the sharpness to only 2 or 3 for best results.

The speakers are loud enough. But it's bottom firing not front. Also the speakers has more mid range and not much low end. Means not much base or clarity. Best with a surround sound system. With dts it's amazing.

Worst thing is about it is probably connectivity. In my house, in the farthest corner my phone can pick up the wifi signal with ease and without much signal loss. But this can not do that. If by chance it gets connected it can't even access internet due to massive signal loss.

You can probably buy a separate bluetooth remote with google assistant button if you need, but it's much easier to use your phone as the remote.

For casting or mirroring phone u need a app to be installed, that another manual work which we need to go through.

The VU 43 Inch full HD LED TV is exactly as described and total value for money. Have been using the product for about two weeks now and have been fully satisfied.

Pros

* Value for money.
* All apps that are routinely available and required for a smart TV can be installed.
* Self installation is easy if setting up on a table top.
* Decent connectivity with two USB ports and two HDMI ports (including one ARC) which am using to connect to my home theatre system.

Cons

* Not related to the product but support from Flipkart. It has been two weeks since the product has been delivered and the promised free installation is yet to materialise. Speaks poor of the support. I am not sure if warranty issues too would be poor too.

* There is a slight initial lag in starting any app immediately when the TV is switched on. Once it stabilizes, there are absolutely no issues at all. Just a minor issue and not really a problem especially considering it's almost half the price of brands like Sony.

Overall, fully satisfied till date except for the installation part which is yet to happen.

Got this for bedroom.
Pros:
Picture quality is awesome.
Sound is excellent for a small room. 20W speaker might not be sufficient for big halls/rooms.
Remote is of good quality.
Installation was quick without any hastles.
All above points are easy to notice in any review.
Did not try out playing games so can't add anything yet in Gaming performance.

Cons: (not a big deal but worth mentioning)
TV takes time to start which was surprising and even after starting, at times it takes time for the remote to respond to your commands. May be this is expected for an Android OS TV with less RAM.
Setting up of Apps takes time at the first try because of slowness.
Within few days my Dad asked me to authenticate to Prime Video again as somehow App got reset losing data. Again, not a big deal once or twice but this can't keep happening. Hopefully it doesn't.

Overall a good TV for a small family or a small room.
I was also looking for Infinix which was launched while I bought this TV. Infinix has more or less same features and at 3K less price point but since it is first time Infinix released TV we didn't want to take chance. Moreover we already had 55" VU TV bought few years back which is working perfectly and hence we voted for VU.

I bought the 43 inch version, it is full high definition, it is an Android TV, it supports all the various OTT platforms, can play any movie you throw at it, has a full form Bluetooth remote and everything you want in a TV like this.
However everything is not perfect. It is not a voice remote and you will want one once you have a TV like this. in the cover of the TV it says it supports Google Assistant, however I was unable to make it function. It could be my problem. I also noticed that Amazon prime has lesser volume than other OTT platforms like YouTube. I have some Anime with 8-bit and 10-bit encoding and the native player could not work it, but once I downloaded MX Player, it ran smooth enough.
The TV arrived within 2 days and installation happened the very next day which was professionally and neatly done.the TV was wall mounted perfectly with the wall bracket that came with the packet. It is always better to buy a TV from Flipkart especially during these times. Flipkart and Vu is the perfect choice.
A side note: Once you buy a TV, never look for TV's or TV advertisements in any platform because you are going to get depressed. Right after I bought VU premium TV I was inundated with VU Cinema TV and the new cheaper Oneplus TV. I am not unhappy with my purchase, because this was the right choice for me at this price point as both the TVs I mentioned were higher priced. I paid an extra 1500 for extra 2 years of warranty. And don't forget an apt Voltage Stabiliser that you have to buy.
My final verdict: Buy it, you won't regret, I love the theatre experience with the big bright screen and the loud 24 watt speaker volume. It is always better to buy a full high definition TV or 4K even though it might consume more power, in the end, you will be more satisfied with the brilliant picture.
